at0000.1.description: *Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).(en)
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Interacción, contacto o evento de cuidados entre un sujeto de cuidados y uno o más proveedores de cuidados de la salud.
*Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).(en)
Interação, contato ou cuidado entre o sujeito do cuidado e profissional(is) de saúde.
Interacción, contacto o evento de cuidado entre un paciente y un proveedor de salud.
*Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: *Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0012.1.description: *Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0012.1.comment:
*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

(en)

at0077.1.description:
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.
(en)

at0003.1.description: Fecha y hora, estimado o real, cuándo el problema/diagnóstico es detectado por un profesional de la salud

at0005.1.description: Valoración de la severidad del problema/diagnóstico

at0072.1.description: Descripción narrativa del progreso del problema/diagnóstico desde su comienzo

at0030.1.description: Día y hora, estimado o real, en que el problema/diagnóstico fue resuelto o entró en remisión

at0073.1.description: *The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)

at0069.1.description: Comentario narrativo adicional sobre el problema/diagnóstico no capturado en otros campos

at0070.1.description: Fecha en la que el problema/diagnóstico fue actualizado

at0000.1.description: Detalles acerca de una condición de salud, lesión, incapacidad o cualquier otra cuerstión, univocamente identificadas, que impacta sobre el bienestar físico, mental y/o social de un individuo
at0000.1.comment: La delineación entre el alcance de un problema versus el diagnóstico puede no ser fácil de lograr en la práctica. A los fines de la documentación clínica mediante este arquetipo, problema y diagnóstico son considerados un continuo, donde niveles incrementales de detalles y evidencia de apoyo otorgan mas peso a la etiqueta de "diagnóstico".

at0002.1.description: Identificación del problema o diagnóstico, por nombre.
at0002.1.comment: Se prefiere la codificación del nombre del problema o diagnóstico mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible.

at0009.1.description: Descripción narrativa del problema o diagnóstico.
at0009.1.comment: Utilizar para proveer trasfondo y contexto, incluyendo evolución, episodios o exacerbaciones, progreso y cualquier otro detalles relevante acerca del problema o diagnóstico.

at0012.1.description: Identificación de un sitio corporal simple para la localización o el problema.
at0012.1.comment:
Se prefiere la codificación de la localización anatómica mediante una terminología cuando esto sea posible.
Utilícese este dato para registrar localizaciones anatómicas precoordinadas. Si los requerimientos para el registro de una localización anatómica son determinadas en tiempo de ejecución por parte de la aplicación, o se requiere un modelado más complejo tal como una localización relativa, utilícese CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location dentro del slot "localización anatómica estructurada" en este arquetipo. Las ocurrencias de este dato son ilimitadas para así permitir escenarios clínicos tales como la descripción de un rash en múltiples localizaciones pero donde todos los demás atributos son idénticos. Si la localización anatómica esta incluida en el nombre del problema o diagnóstico mediante códigos precoordinados, este dato se torna redundante.

at0077.1.description: Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales los signos o síntomas del problema fueron observados por primera vez.
at0077.1.comment: Los datos registrados o importados como "Edad a la aparición" deberán ser convertidos a una fecha utilizando la fecha de nacimiento del sujeto.

at0003.1.text: Fecha y hora del reconocimiento clínico
at0003.1.description: Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales el diagnóstico o problema fue reconocido por el profesional de la salud.
at0003.1.comment: El uso de fechas parciales es aceptable. Si el sujeto de cuidados tiene menos de un año de edad, se requiere la fecha completa o al menos el año y mes para permitir cálculos adecuados (si por ejemplo se utiliza para guiar un apoyo a la toma de decisiones). Los datos registrados o importados como "Edad a la aparición" deberán ser convertidos a una fecha utilizando la fecha de nacimiento del sujeto.

at0005.1.description: Una evaluación de la severidad general del problema o diagnóstico.
at0005.1.comment: Si la severidad del problema o diagnóstico esta incluida en su nombre mediante códigos precoordinados, este dato se torna redundante. Nota: una gradación ,as específica de severidad puede ser registrada utilizando el slot de Detalles específicos.

at0072.1.description: Descripción narrativa del curso del problema o diagnóstico desde su aparición.

at0030.1.description: Fecha y hora estimadas o confirmadas en las cuales este problema o diagnóstico remitió o se resolvió, determinadas de un profesional de la salud.
at0030.1.comment: El uso de fechas parciales es aceptable. Si el sujeto de cuidados tiene menos de un año de edad, se requiere la fecha completa o al menos el año y mes para permitir cálculos adecuados (si por ejemplo se utiliza para guiar un apoyo a la toma de decisiones).

at0073.1.description: El nivel de certeza de la identificación del diagnóstico.

at0069.1.description: Narrativa adicional acerca del problema o diagnóstico que no ha sido consignada en otros campos.

at0070.1.description: La fecha de la última actualización de este problema o diagnóstico.

at0000.1.description: *Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.(en)

at0002.1.description: *Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.(en)
at0002.1.comment: *Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0009.1.description: *Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0009.1.comment: *Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.(en)

at0012.1.description: *Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0012.1.comment:
*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

(en)

at0077.1.description:
*Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.
(en)

at0003.1.description: *Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.(en)
at0003.1.comment: *Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support.(en)

at0005.1.description: *An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0005.1.comment: *If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.(en)

at0072.1.description: *Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.(en)

at0030.1.description: *Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.(en)
at0030.1.comment: *Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support.(en)

at0073.1.description: *The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.(en)

at0069.1.description: *Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.(en)

at0070.1.description: *The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.(en)

at0000.1.description: Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.
at0000.1.comment: Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.

at0002.1.description: Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.
at0002.1.comment: Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0009.1.description: Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.
at0009.1.comment: Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.

at0077.1.description: Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.
at0077.1.comment: Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

at0003.1.description: Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.
at0003.1.comment: Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

at0005.1.description: An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.
at0005.1.comment: If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.

at0072.1.description: Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.

at0030.1.description: Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.
at0030.1.comment: Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.

at0073.1.description: The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.

at0069.1.description: Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.

at0070.1.description: The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.

at0002.1.description: Identifisering av problemet eller diagnosen ved hjelp av navn.
at0002.1.comment: Koding av navnet på problemet eller diagnosen med en terminologi er foretrukket, der det er mulig.

at0009.1.comment: Brukes til å gi bakgrunn og kontekst, inkludert utvikling, episoder eller forverringer, fremgang og alle andre relevante detaljer, om problemet eller diagnosen.

at0012.1.description: *Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.(en)
at0012.1.comment:
*Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

(en)

at0077.1.description: Antatt eller faktisk dato/tid da tegn eller symptomer på problemet eller diagnosen først ble observert.

at0003.1.description: Antatt eller faktisk dato/tid da diagnosen eller problemet ble bekreftet av helsepersonell.
at0003.1.comment: Delvise datoer er tillatt. Dersom individet er under ett år gammel, må komplett dato eller som et minimum måned og år oppgis for å muliggjøre presise beregninger av alder, f.eks. ved bruk i beslutningsstøttesystemer.

at0005.1.description: En vurdering av problemet eller diagnosens overordnede alvorlighetsgrad.
at0005.1.comment: Dersom alvorlighetsgrad inkluderes i feltet "Problem/diagnosenavn" via prekoordinerte koder blir dette dataelementet overflødig. Merk: Mer spesifikk gradering av alvorlighetsgrad kan registreres ved å bruke SLOTet "Spesifikke detaljer"

at0072.1.description: Fritekstbeskrivelse av forløpet av problemet eller diagnosen siden debut.

at0030.1.description: Estimert eller faktisk dato/tid for bedring eller remisjon av det aktuelle problemet eller diagnosen, fastslått av helsepersonell.
at0030.1.comment: Delvise datoer er tillatt. Dersom individet er under ett år gammel, må komplett dato eller som et minimum måned og år oppgis for å muliggjøre presise beregninger av alder, f.eks. ved bruk i beslutningsstøttesystemer.

at0073.1.description: Grad av sikkerhet i identifikasjonen av diagnosen.

at0069.1.description: Utdypende fritekst om problemet eller diagnosen, som ikke passer i andre felt.

at0070.1.description: Datoen da problemet eller diagnosen sist ble oppdatert.

author.name: Jasmin Buck, Sebastian Garde
author.organisation: University of Heidelberg, Central Queensland University

author.name: Silje Ljosland Bakke, John Tore Valand
Alan March
author.organisation: Hospital Universitario Austral, Buenos Aires, Argentina

at0000.1.description: Details about findings that support a clinical assertion.

at0003.1.description: Identification of the finding that supports the assertion.
at0003.1.comment: It is recommended that 'Finding' should be coded with a terminology, where possible.

at0005.1.description: Measurement or value associated with the finding.

at0006.1.description: The date on which the finding was clinically identified.
at0006.1.comment: For example: The date when the finding was made by or made available to the clinician.

at0022.1.description: Type of examination or investigation used to identify the evidence.
at0022.1.comment: Consider coding 'Method' with a terminology, where possible. For example: Physical examination, Chest x-ray, Histopathology result, Colonoscopy.

at0001.1.description: Narrative description of the method used to identify the evidence.

at0023.1.description: Additional narrative about the finding not captured in other fields.

at0003.1.comment: Det anbefales å kode "Funn" med en terminologi, der det er mulig.

at0005.1.description: Måling eller verdi knyttet til funnet.

at0006.1.description: Datoen da funnet ble klinisk anerkjent.
at0006.1.comment: For eksempel: Datoen da funnet ble gjort eller gjort tilgjengelig for klinikeren.

at0022.1.description: Typen undersøkelse eller utredning som er utført for å komme fram til funnet.
at0022.1.comment: Metoden bør vurderes kodet med en terminologi der dette er mulig. For eksempel fysisk undersøkelse, røntgen thorax, patologisvar, koloskopi.

at0001.1.description: Fritekstbeskrivelse av metoden som ble brukt for å komme fram til funnet.

at0023.1.description: Ytterligere informasjon om funnet, som ikke kan registreres i andre felter.

translations.accreditation: Certified Board of Family Medicine in South Korea
